subcategory: DEI-related internal communications are frequently ignored by the majority of employees
description: This refers to messages, policies, and initiatives that an organization communicates to its employees with the aim of promoting diversity, but the majority of employees tend to ignore it.

content.text: Internal information channels of organizations are scattered.
There is an overload of information on internal communication channels and sometimes the information is difficult to access.
There is lack of effective communication from the managerâ€™s side.
Organizations need to measure the results of their internal communication strategy for DEI; appropriate adjustments should be made to improve effectiveness.
Organizations should take employee feedback about the communication channels and take steps for improvement.
Organizations should use infographics to convey information in place of raw data.
The communication model can be changed from a top-down model to horizontal communication.
Organizations should let managers deliver corporate messages in their own words in meetings to make things easier to understand and comprehend.
